programme.desc: A profile of the North American country, an ancient land full of diversity and mystery, and home to a vast wilderness of oceans, deserts, jungle and unique creatures

programme.desc: Jeff Watson teaches his grizzlies to forage in the wild, but when Bob slashes him in the arm he is forced to reconsider the difficulty of them leaving the nest

programme.title: The Zoo: San Diego
programme.desc: When lesser flamingo eggs and chicks are being preyed upon, the team must make a nerve-wracking decision. Plus, a wallaby and her joey become ambassador animals

programme.title: The Zoo: San Diego
programme.desc: After taking over the former red river hog habitat, a gazelle gives the team a big surprise. Staff race to prepare a den when they suspect the Amur leopard is pregnant

programme.title: Lone Star Law
programme.desc: Texas Game Wardens Henson and Harper investigate a deer poaching case in which a confession from a suspect reveals the killing of more than 40 deer

programme.title: Dr Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: A beloved poodle is rushed into surgery, Dr Jeff heads out to operate on an alligator, and four turtles, unable to eat, get their first vet visit in 43 years

programme.desc: The Raneys turn the cameras on themselves as they shelter on their Alaskan homestead. Elsewhere, Marty tracks the predators of a moose kill found near their cabin

programme.title: Project Grizzly
programme.desc: Jeff Watsons unconventional hunting lessons fail to prepare Bob and Screech to hunt game in the wild - but he discovers they may be learning on their own

programme.title: Tanked
programme.sub-title: When the Moon(shine) Hits Your Eye
programme.desc: Wayde King and Brett Raymer travel to Tennessee, where the Hatfield and McCoys dinner theatre wants to replace an old moonshine still with an aquarium

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Charles Jantzen leads the biggest horse rescue of the year, while investigator Trischa Price comes to the aid of a dog left at home alone

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Charles Jantzen leads an investigation into a kennel suspected of housing more than 50 ill-treated dogs

programme.title: Pit Bulls and Parolees
programme.desc: Tania and Earl set off to rescue an adopted dog that has mysteriously turned up in a Mississippi shelter. Parolee Joe is shaken after separating two stray dogs fighting

programme.title: Alaska: Homestead Rescue
programme.sub-title: Home Sweet Homestead: Cold Hard Lockdown
programme.desc: The intense winter has frozen the water supply on the homestead, forcing Marty to hunt for a new source. Meanwhile in Hawaii, Matt and Katie harvest cacao

programme.title: Lone Star Law
programme.desc: Documentary following Texas game wardens as they fight crime and protect natural resources. In South Texas, a warden assists in releasing cold-stunned sea turtles back into the sea. A standard patrol at a fishing spot leads to a drugs bust and a manhunt

programme.title: Dr Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Dr Jeffs team races to help a tiny dog to deliver a large puppy and save both lives. The vets also head downtown to help homeless people and their pets

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Pete Nelson installs a stainless steel kitchen in the trees for a family of sweet-makers. The treehouse also boasts barrel ceilings and a loft bedroom

programme.title: Dog Detectives
programme.desc: In Yorkshire, PC Fletchers dog Patto gets injured chasing a burglar. In Merseyside, PC Harris and his dog Kane try to track down the driver of a stolen car

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: Otto, Jane and Shane transport a cabin to the distant and uninhabited Perl Island - but things take a sinister turn when they discover a predator is on the loose

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: With a huge storm predicted, the siblings rush to complete a project to capture and store water. Meanwhile, Gabe prepares for his wedding with a surprise bachelor party

programme.title: Pit Bulls and Parolees
programme.desc: Tania and Earl set off to rescue an adopted dog that has mysteriously turned up in a Mississippi shelter. Parolee Joe is shaken after separating two stray dogs fighting

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Charles Jantzen leads an investigation into a kennel suspected of housing more than 50 ill-treated dogs

programme.title: Live Snooker: UK Championship
programme.desc: Seema Jaswal presents coverage of the evening session on day four at York Barbican, featuring the concluding two first-round matches, played over the best of 11 frames. At this stage last year, Zhang Anda won six of the last seven frames against Lei Peifan to secure a 6-3 victory, scoring a maximum 147 break in the process. In the sessions over contest, Stuart Bingham fought back from 5-2 down against two-time champion Mark Williams to prevail 6-5. With commentary and analysis from Steve Davis, John Parrott, Ken Doherty, Dennis Taylor and Stephen Hendry, and reports from Shabnam Younus-Jewell

programme.title: The Hidden Children of Ruinerwold Farm
programme.desc: In 2019, the Dutch village of Ruinerwold became world news when a hidden family were discovered on a local farm, where six adult children had been kept in seclusion and abused by their father Gerrit-Jan Van Dorsten, a self-proclaimed prophet. Now 24-year-old Israel is reunited with his older brothers Shin and Edino and sister Mar Jan to recount their experiences growing up in the dark shadow of their fathers beliefs

programme.title: The Hidden Children of Ruinerwold Farm
programme.desc: Allegations of physical and sexual abuse come under discussion and three of the older children decide to visit their father, who is in a secure hospital following a stroke. First broadcast 24 October 2023

programme.title: Britains Outlaws: Highwaymen, Pirates and Rogues
programme.desc: Sam Willis concludes his exploration of the criminal underworld of the 17th and 18th centuries by looking at urban crime, fraud and corruption, uncovering a fascinating rogues gallery of villains. He examines the case of thief and serial escaper Jack Sheppard, who was so notorious that almost a quarter of a million people turned up to witness his hanging, while fraudster Mary Toft managed to convince George Is surgeon that she had given birth to rabbits

programme.title: The Brits Who Designed the Modern World
programme.desc: Arts reporter Brenda Emmanus marks the opening of Kensingtons new Design Museum this month by profiling 10 of the most celebrated living British designers, whose work has revolutionised the nations homes, streets and culture since the Second World War. Among those whose careers are highlighted are road-sign designer Margaret Calvert, ZX Spectrum creator Rick Dickinson, Andrew Ritchie, who gave the world the Brompton Bike, and Kenneth Grange, who designed everything from British Rails distinctive InterCity 125 to Kenwood food mixers. A panel of contributors including Will.i.am, Jeremy Paxman, Pete Waterman and Ade Adepitan explain how their lives have benefited from British designs

programme.title: Wainwright: The Man Who Loved the Lakes
programme.desc: Part-dramatised profile of writer and artist Alfred Wainwright, the enthusiastic fell-walker from Blackburn who became renowned for his pictorial guides to the English Lake District. More than two million copies have been sold since he began writing them in 1955, and they have become the standard reference work for the area

programme.title: Britains Outlaws: Highwaymen, Pirates and Rogues
programme.desc: Sam Willis concludes his exploration of the criminal underworld of the 17th and 18th centuries by looking at urban crime, fraud and corruption, uncovering a fascinating rogues gallery of villains. He examines the case of thief and serial escaper Jack Sheppard, who was so notorious that almost a quarter of a million people turned up to witness his hanging, while fraudster Mary Toft managed to convince George Is surgeon that she had given birth to rabbits

programme.title: Winter Walks
programme.desc: Poet laureate Simon Armitage takes a coastal walk along Yorkshires enchanting and historic frontier with the North Sea. Starting in Ravenscar, Simon follows a disused railway line, passing former quarries and brickworks, before walking along the beach from Boggle Hole to the picture-perfect Robin Hoods Bay

programme.title: Christmas University Challenge
programme.sub-title: Durham University v University of York
programme.desc: Alumni of Durham University face graduates of the University of York in the third match of the 2022 festive edition of the academic quiz, with documentary maker Chris Terrill taking the captains chair for Durham, and YouTuber Tom Scott heading the team from York. Hosted by Jeremy Paxman

programme.title: The Magical World of Moss
programme.desc: A visit to moss-covered landscapes in Japan, Iceland, France and Denmark where scientists are investigating the astonishing properties and potential of these plants. Mosses evolved from oceanic algae that emerged onto the land 450 million years ago, and have become a main source of oxygen for the evolving planet - yet science is only beginning to understand the secrets and the possibilities they hold

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Revisiting the African lions that learned to prey on elephants in the drought-ridden Kalahari Desert, and catching up with the pride during the rainy season. Imogen Stubbs narrates

programme.title: Live Snooker: UK Championship
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine presents further coverage of the evening session on day five at York Barbican, featuring two second-round matches, played over the best of 11 frames. Jack Lisowski claimed a 6-4 victory over Ali Carter at this stage last year, and 2022 champion Mark Allen came back from 4-2 down to prevail by the same scoreline against Wu Yize. With commentary and analysis from Steve Davis, John Parrott, Ken Doherty, Dennis Taylor and Stephen Hendry, and reports from Shabnam Younus-Jewell

programme.title: The Tenant of Wildfell Hall
programme.desc: Three-part drama series based on Anne Brontes novel. A painter and her son arrive at Wildfell Hall, fuelling rumours among villagers that she is harbouring a dark secret. Lonely and withdrawn, she is befriended by a local farmer - but will she trust him enough to reveal the truth about her past? Starring Tara Fitzgerald, Toby Stephens, Rupert Graves and Pam Ferris

programme.title: The Tenant of Wildfell Hall
programme.desc: Helen gives Gilbert her journal, explaining her life story from her first meeting with the dashing Arthur Huntingdon when, at the age of 18, she was eager for excitement and romance. Starring Tara Fitzgerald, Toby Stephens, Pam Ferris and Rupert Graves

programme.title: The Tenant of Wildfell Hall
programme.desc: Helen and her son Arthur are forced to leave Wildfell as a mysterious coach arrives at the hall, while Gilbert reads her diary and learns of her years of misery and neglect at the hands of Huntingdon. Final part of the adaptation of Anne Brontes classic, starring Tara Fitzgerald, Rupert Graves and Toby Stephens.

programme.title: Birth of the British Novel
programme.desc: Author and critic Henry Hitchings explores the evolution of the novel in 18th-century Britain, and offers his view that it was a time of cultural revolution. He examines the social and political history of the period, uses paintings by great artists to illustrate scenes from key novels, and explains how major genres from light entertainment for female readers to political thrillers were perfected. Along the way, he meets authors including Martin Amis, Will Self, Tom McCarthy and Jenny Uglow

programme.title: The Magical World of Moss
programme.desc: A visit to moss-covered landscapes in Japan, Iceland, France and Denmark where scientists are investigating the astonishing properties and potential of these plants. Mosses evolved from oceanic algae that emerged onto the land 450 million years ago, and have become a main source of oxygen for the evolving planet - yet science is only beginning to understand the secrets and the possibilities they hold

programme.title: The Lost Libraries of Timbuktu
programme.desc: Aminatta Forna presents a documentary examining the literary tradition of Timbuktu in Mali, where hundreds of thousands of manuscripts have come to light in recent years. From the 13th to the 16th centuries, the city was a renowned seat of learning, and its black African scholars were revered throughout the Islamic world

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Louise Minchin and Rav Wilding present the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Louise Minchin, Gloria Hunniford and Julia Somerville investigate a telecoms firm making promises about contracts that business owners say it fails to keep. Plus, the homeowners who blame a trusted tradesperson website for putting them in touch with a cowboy builder who left them with a bill for tens of thousands of pounds, how criminals are spoofing email addresses to scam people and the robot vacuum cleaner that fell down the stairs

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Tommy Wash track the progress of renovations on two houses in London valued at over a million pounds each and a development in Huddersfield

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Experts Charles Hanson and Caroline Hawley help two teams look for items in the Lancashire town of Eccleston. Eric Knowles oversees proceedings and also goes to the nearby town of Chorley to quiz locals on a miniature antique he has brought along

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Marvellous Miniature Workshop
programme.desc: Abi Trotman recreates a miniature version of a 1980s east London school classroom for restaurateur Kim, capturing memories of a beloved teacher and the first real sense of safety and belonging. Presented by Sara Cox

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: After leaving teaching, Clare turned to metalwork and retrained as a blacksmith. Having just finished her studies, she needs to start making money so that she and her partner can save up a deposit for their first home. Orchestra box office manager Gavin, who currently lives with his mother, wants his own place with more space for him and his equipment. They both seek advice on how to turn their hobbies into viable careers from Dom Chinea and his team of experts

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps a couple move from Germany to the British countryside, as they search for their ideal home in either Herefordshire or Gloucestershire. He also meets a writer living her best life in the country

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers presents as dealers bid for a miniature sewing machine from the 1950s thats been in storage for more than 33 years, a canteen of silver cutlery, a wartime accordion, gingerbread moulds from the Netherlands and old accounts ledgers

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Raj Bisram and Briony Harford travel through Hampshire, where items that catch their eye include a fine piece of furniture and a rare document signed by none other than Louis XIV. They also take a detour to a historic steamship, once used to haul a rather unsavoury cargo, but now restored as a proud symbol of Britains maritime heritage

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Stephen Mangan

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Lauren Laverne present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Zoe has some difficult questions for a loved one, Anthony confronts Howie about his suspicions, Nicola tries to protect Harry, and Anna makes it her mission to build bridges between Kojo, Gina and Harry before she leaves

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: Singer Alfie Boe, ex-rugby union player Alun Wyn Jones, reality star Ashley Cain, Gladiator Jodie Ounsley and comedian Noreen Khan compete to secure a place in the last quarter-final. They start by lifting their cloche to reveal a random ingredient to use in their first dish, before a blindfold test in which they must identify cubes of meat, fish or fruit by touch and taste only. Finally, they have one hour to cook a dish they would be proud to serve on their own food stall

programme.title: Whats the Monarchy For?
programme.desc: With recent events having put the royal family under the spotlight, David Dimbleby probes politicians and insiders on fundamental questions about the institution at the heart of the nation. He begins by questioning how much power and influence the monarch really has. It is said that kings and queens should be politically neutral but is that true? And in a world where political leaders are continually under attack, what role is there for an unelected head of state? Contributors include David Cameron and Jacob Rees-Mogg

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: Spotlight
programme.desc: Mandy McAuley traces the stages of the crisis currently gripping the Presbyterian Church, from the child abuse case that sparked an internal inquiry through to the resignation of the Churchs leader

programme.title: Tommy: The Good. The Bad. The Fury
programme.desc: After the success of his comeback fight, Tommys road to redemption hits a major setback - his hand is injured again and needs eight weeks total rest before doctors will know if he can fight again. The last time he couldnt train, his life spiralled out of control, so now Tommy throws himself into a frenzy of activity - a TV appearance on The Wheel, family days out with Bambi and a final push to finish the home he hopes Molly and Bambi will soon return to

programme.title: Tommy: The Good. The Bad. The Fury
programme.desc: Tommys recovery is back on track after he and John put his hand to the test. The pair are training again, and the search for Tommys next opponent begins. Eager to make the most of family time, Tommy splashes out on a £90,000 motor home for family trips with Molly and Bambi and takes his mother out for lunch and a long-overdue catch-up. Tommy reveals that John has had a recent health scare, so to cheer him up, father and son take their very different caravans to a local steam fair

programme.title: Lara Croft: Tomb Raider
programme.desc: The gun-toting treasure seeker is thrown into a furious battle with a mysterious secret society as she races against time to locate the missing pieces of a legendary artefact that grants the owner the ability to control time. Action adventure based on the video games, starring Angelina Jolie, Daniel Craig, Leslie Phillips, Iain Glen, Chris Barrie and Jon Voight

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Louise Minchin and Greg Rutherford present the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Julia Somerville, Louise Minchin and Gloria Hunniford tell the story of how a car finance companys mistake led to the credit record of a man from Blackpool being merged with a man from south Wales who shared his name - leading to problems when he applied for a mortgage. Plus, a look at whether deaf movie lovers are being short-changed by cinema chains, and a broadband companys customers who say quitting their contract is far too difficult

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.sub-title: With a Little Help from Some Friends
programme.desc: Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin visit a scrap of land that becomes home to a three-bedroom house in Staffordshire and follow transformations in Liverpool and Torquay

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion is in Shrewsbury, Shropshire, where she takes a ride on one of Englands oldest and steepest mountainside railways. With Philip Serrell and Izzie Balmer

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Marvellous Miniature Workshop
programme.desc: Sara Cox is joined by craftsman Lee Robinson who recreates Silverwood Colliery in miniature, while ex-miners Reg and Neil share memories of community, hardship and pride in their South Yorkshire pit

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Coppersmith Ian wants to get out of the hobby zone but needs to develop his skills. Crocheter Louise needs to focus her work to be able to go full-time

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps a buyer find a new home in Suffolk, where he also meets a couple who have established a biodiverse wildflower meadow

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.sub-title: Chess Set, Clockwork Cars, Victorian Sewing Table
programme.desc: Nigel Havers meets five more sellers hoping to raises money with a lovingly restored antique chess set, a Victorian sewing table, an oak gong, a piece of Rolls-Royce advertising and a collection of clockwork cars

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Raj Bisram and Briony Harfords antique hunt brings them to Kent. Briony falls for a charming canine portrait that might have a hidden pedigree, Raj goes supersonic with Concorde memorabilia and the pair take a detour to a famous racing circuit

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts the quiz in which contestants try to record the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Stephen Mangan reveals the correct answers and comments on the players scores

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Clara Amfo and Alex Jones present the magazine show, with celebrity guests and stories of interest from around the UK

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Anthony and Howie are desperate to both keep their secrets as Kim plans her engagement party. However, as loose lips cause big trouble, the event doesnt go to plan. Lilys concern for Jeans mental health intensifies as she struggles in the wake of Freddies departure, and Nigel commences auditions for his film

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: Alfie Boe, Alun Wyn Jones, Ashley Cain, Jodie Ounsley and Noreen Khan compete in the latest heat, each intent on impressing judges Grace Dent and John Torode. Two challenges await and a place in the quarter-finals is for the taking. Theres a familiar face setting the latest brief - 2021 MasterChef finalist Alexina Anatole, who has a passion for pairing ingredients that would ordinarily raise alarm bells. Each contender has one of her recipes that celebrate bitterness, which they need to incorporate into their dish, ensuring every element works in harmony. This is a careful balancing act as one mistake could leave a bitter taste in everyones mouth

programme.title: Shetland
programme.desc: Tosh finally confronts Billy about Robert Tullochs past in the police force, suspecting his mentor was corrupt - a suggestion that Billy angrily rejects. Calder waits anxiously at the hospital for news about Louden, but her guilt eventually prompts her to go after the people responsible for the assault. A new suspect comes to light when a fingerprint at Eadies house is identified. However, Calder and Toshs interrogation of this Lunniswick local takes a surprising turn, revealing a shameful secret

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: Plough On!
programme.desc: Documentary following a Co Down mans dream of becoming world ploughing champion - from the fields of Northern Ireland to a shot at glory in the Czech Republic. Andrew Gill lives in Dromore, a ploughing heartland steeped in Ulster-Scots heritage and the birthplace of Harry Ferguson, the inventor whose tractor revolutionised farming worldwide. Andrews story is made all the more extraordinary by the fact that, at just 23, he was diagnosed with leukaemia. With the unwavering support of his family, Andrew overcame the disease and went on to represent Northern Ireland at world championships in America, Ireland, Latvia and Estonia

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Action from the midweek Premier League matches, including Arsenal v Brentford at Emirates Stadium and Liverpool v Sunderland at Anfield. Title-challenging Arsenal hosted their fellow Londoners, who held them to a 1-1 draw here last term, and champions Liverpool took on a Sunderland side that have impressed so far this term. Plus, Brighton and Hove Albion v Aston Villa, Burnley v Crystal Palace, Wolverhampton Wanderers v Nottingham Forest, Leeds United v Chelsea, Bournemouth v Everton, Fulham v Manchester City and Newcastle United v Tottenham Hotspur

programme.title: Alan Carrs Picture Slam
programme.desc: Alan Carr hosts this game show in which three teams of contestants have to identify a board full of images, with a chance of winning up to £10,000 if they know them all. This episodes contenders are three couples from Bedfordshire, Grimsby, and Dunfermline

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Everything from roads to baths to pies, hosts Emperor Nero and warrior queen Boudicca are here to show what the Romans did while they were here in Britain

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Grisly tales of the Civil War, one of the weirdest, wildest periods in English history, featuring the only time that a king has been tried and executed for treason

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May travel to America for an interstate road trip, completing various challenges along the way. Starting in Miami, they each buy a car for less than $1,000 and drive to New Orleans, where they set out to give their vehicles away to people who suffered in Hurricane Katrina

programme.title: Tommy: The Good. The Bad. The Fury
programme.desc: After the success of his comeback fight, Tommys road to redemption hits a major setback - his hand is injured again and needs eight weeks total rest before doctors will know if he can fight again. The last time he couldnt train, his life spiralled out of control, so now Tommy throws himself into a frenzy of activity - a TV appearance on The Wheel, family days out with Bambi and a final push to finish the home he hopes Molly and Bambi will soon return to

Eager to make the most of family time, Tommy splashes out on a £90,000 motor home for family trips with Molly and Bambi and takes his mother out for lunch and a long-overdue catch-up. Tommy reveals that John has had a recent health scare, so to cheer him up, father and son take their very different caravans to a local steam fair

programme.title: Dating Apps: The Inside Story
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the Match Group, the corporation behind some of the worlds biggest online dating apps, and revealing the duplicity at the heart of the matchmaking services on offer. Surveys consistently find the majority of users are seeking long-term and serious relationships. However, this programme reveals how they have been sold a lie, and are manipulated in the pursuit of profit

programme.title: Ashley Cain: Into the Danger Zone
programme.desc: Frances second-largest city Marseille has been the nations drug capital for over 50 years, but the violence of its drug war is escalating, as rival gangs kidnap, torture, kill and even set one another on fire. Ashley spends time in the notorious northern suburbs known as the cites, meeting young men involved in fighting the bloody drug war as well as riding along with the police on a night-time patrol

programme.title: Ashley Cain: Into the Danger Zone
programme.desc: The former footballer heads deep into the Colombian jungle to find out why gold is now twice as valuable than cocaine to the countrys organised crime groups, meeting the young men drawn into this illegal venture, discovering the shocking health impact mining is having on them, as well as meeting the cartel gangsters who control almost every element of life in these remote regions

programme.title: Top Gear

programme.desc: Giovanna and Baby Bear welcome little ones Oakley, Arthur, Luna, Reau, Tylana and their grown-ups to The Baby Club. Parents, carers and their babies at home are invited to join in with all the fun activities too! Inside Giovannas bag is a toy camera, and all the parents and babies have different objects and toys that are themed around a day out. These are explored through discovery, play, song and story. Grown-ups at home are encouraged to take part by hiding safe, baby-appropriate toys and objects inside a fabric bag or pillowcase for them to reveal and explore with their baby! The fun song Looking Out on Our Day Out features, as does a story involving Baby Bear. Viewers at home show how theyve been exploring things that are themed around a day out too. The Together Song gets everyone moving about, before some calm time with sensory bubbles and the Goodbye Song.

programme.desc: Debra suffers from PMT, so Ray decides to help alleviate her symptoms - but only succeeds in making matters worse. Ray Romano stars

programme.desc: Robert returns to work after sick leave, but is soon driven to the conclusion that he does not have the nerve to be a policeman any more and decides to pursue a safer career in telemarketing

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The prospect of Christmas with his son Frederick leaves Frasier panicking about what presents to buy him, and it takes a reminder from Martin about the festive spirit to keep him on the right track

programme.title: Frasier
programme.sub-title: Its Hard to Say Goodbye If You Wont Leave

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The psychiatrist suddenly realises he has a shortage of friends in Seattle, as most of his old ones are back in Boston. He announces on air he is looking for companionship and gets a lot more than he bargained for. Guest starring Griffin Dunne, with Kelsey Grammer

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Joe spends the night in Daphnes room, causing a shocked Frasiers mind to work overtime and Niles to become consumed by jealousy. Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce star

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Frank Fritz finds a huge stash of beer-related memorabilia belonging to an Oktoberfest fan. Mike Wolfe makes an offer on an ultra-rare Edison invention

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: At Janet and Philips chateau, they try to complete their hallway transformation before their Christmas extravaganza. Its also all hands on deck at Chateau de Dohem for Wendy and Marcus, as they prepare for their first-ever Christmas-themed murder mystery party. At Chateau de Lalacelle, Terry and Ashley make their own snow indoors by bringing down one of the chateau ceilings, before they can switch on their 5000 lights to start Christmas properly

programme.title: Christmas At
programme.desc: Following events at Harewood House during their Long Live the Christmas Tree showcase, during which 11 cutting-edge artists transform the stately homes grand rooms with their own interpretations of winter festivities. The exhibition embraces the modern and combines a diversity of cultures and local craftsmanship to create a Christmas experience like no other for Harewood Houses 40,000 loyal visitors

programme.title: Countdown

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Barbara and Butch from Leicester are searching for the perfect Italian holiday home in Lucca. For their budget of £90,000, they would like a house with two bedrooms thats within walking distance of amenities. Ben Hillman shows them five fantastic options

programme.title: Kirsties Handmade Christmas
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp offers festive tips on how to have a stylish Christmas without breaking the bank. Embracing the wintery theme, Kirstie is let loose on a block of ice with power tools, before going inside to learn one of this years hottest new crafting trends. In the kitchen, Kirstie overcomes her fear of making pastry, with a decadent choux pastry wreath, and shows that craft and cooking go hand in hand with Christmas crackers made from pasta. She also serves up a boozy hot chocolate and demonstrates how to turn lonely old socks into fun festive friends

programme.title: The Great BandB Challenge
programme.desc: As the second heat continues, the battle moves to the dining room. A delayed bakery run causes stress for Jo and Guy, Paul and Justins breakfast surprise fails to impress and an early arrival causes Nicole and Brett to start ripping up bed sheets

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Craig Rowe goes house-hunting in the southern French city of Carcassonne with Sue and Tony, in search of their perfect holiday bolthole for their budget of £100,000. This isnt the couples first viewing trip to the area, and theres already a property on their radar, but can any of the five that Craig shows them beat it?

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: Ninety-two-year old Mary is rushed in to Queens Medical Centre in Nottingham having been trapped under her car. Second World War veteran Norman, whos 95, is in resus with a dangerously low heart rate, and four-year-old George has come to the childrens emergency department with his dad after getting a stone mysteriously stuck up his nose while playing football

programme.title: Rescue: Extreme Medics
programme.desc: The air ambulance is dispatched to two serious road traffic collisions, while on the west bank of Loch Lomond, a minibus carrying 15 tourists has collided with a car. In South Ayrshire, an 86-year-old grandmother is struggling to breathe after a high-speed crash, and 72-year-old William has a severe cut to his arm after an attempt to chop wood with a circular saw went horrifically wrong

programme.title: The Last Leg
programme.desc: Adam Hills, Josh Widdicombe and Alex Brooker are joined by Chris McCausland, Rose Ayling-Ellis and Adam Buxton for a comic review of the significant moments of the past seven days. As usual, the hashtag #isitok paves the way for the gang to round up, examine and explain the leading and most entertaining news stories of the week

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The owners of Jacks Waterfront at St Clair Shores in Michigan are keen to hear the fiery chefs advice for turning their failing seafood restaurant around. The lakeside location is a popular summer spot with fantastic views, but an uninspiring menu and a manager more skilled at socialising than organising are preventing them from achieving year-round success

programme.title: Double the Money
programme.desc: The remaining teams gather for the semi-final, where they must turn £4,000 into £8,000 in just three weeks. One team host party bus tours, another pair trade in liquidated stock, while others put on food, drinks and music festivals and wellness social networks. Tensions run high as they find out whos made it into the final

programme.title: Stand Up to Cancer
programme.desc: People affected by cancer share their personal and moving stories, in a series of short films in aid of Stand Up To Cancer

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples from Blackpool compete for the £1,000 prize, beginning with practising Buddhist Antonio and former Redcoat Jason, who serve up a sushi starter. A discovery on day two at the home of fireman Daz and his wife Kim raises a few eyebrows, while the final night sees foodies Martin and Kate prepare an authentic Thai menu and a chocolate dessert

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Amando and Vanessa from the West Midlands love holidaying on the beautiful island of Tenerife. Theyve visited 15 times in three years and now want to buy a property of their own to continue to enjoy holidays with their three children. Laura Hamilton lines up five great properties for their budget of £185,000, but are any of them perfect enough for Amando and Vanessa to put in an offer?

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug decides to pursue his dream of becoming a bartender, but Carrie is unimpressed with his plans. Meanwhile, Arthur also attempts a career change, entering the dangerous world of politics. American comedy, starring Kevin James

programme.desc: Robert bumps into his ex-wife, and considers rekindling the relationship. Meanwhile, Frank tells Amy the story of how the pair split up in the first place

programme.desc: Niles takes dancing lessons in preparation for a posh society ball, but his date falls ill at the last minute, so he asks Daphne to go with him instead. Comedy, starring David Hyde Pierce and Jane Leeves

programme.sub-title: The Show Where Diane Comes Back

programme.title: Frasier
programme.sub-title: A Word to the Wise Guy
programme.desc: A shady character helps the Crane brothers get Maris out of a spot of legal trouble - then demands they return the favour by persuading his girlfriend to marry him. Comedy, guest starring Harris Yulin, with Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles is left jumping for joy by an exciting proposal from Maris, while Frasier suggests the family tries something different to mark the leap year. However, all his efforts end in disaster. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz visit a petrol station that has been transformed into a home, where they brave a collection that sends a chill up the spine

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: At Chateau du Puits es Pratx, Tim and Sasha prepare for the final wedding of the season. A couple who married there 10 years ago are returning with their children for a Christmas theyll never forget. At Chateau des Vieilles Vignes, Nick and Nicole are planning a Christmas party but they dont have a floor. With concrete waiting to harden, theres just 24 hours before the party begins. Meanwhile, in the Dordogne, Tim and Krys have big plans for an unforgettable treat for Tims son Owen, while also creating the perfect hot chocolate

programme.title: Christmas At
programme.desc: Seasonal preparations at Palladian stately home Holkham Hall, which is surrounded by a walled park, a 25,000-acre estate and 11 miles of north Norfolk coastline. This year, the Countess of Leicester, announces there is no theme to Christmas and, instead, each state room will boast its own eclectic identity, though the great drawing room becomes a tribute to the late Queen with a Jubilee-inspired red, white and blue tree of gifts. Lady Leicester leads a design team in a frenetic rush to decorate a quarter of a mile of grand saloons, dining rooms and marble halls to pull off a festive stately experience like no other

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Colin Murray and Rachel Riley host the words-and-numbers game where contestants pit their wits against the clock. Harry Aikines-Aryeetey joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Lee Juggurnauth assists retirees Steve and Jackie from Oxfordshire, who want to find a holiday home in Guardamar del Segura, south-east Spain, that they can enjoy with their family and friends. Lee showcases five attractive properties within their budget of £80,000

programme.title: Kirsties Handmade Christmas
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp offers two more weeks of festive tips on how to have a stylish Christmas without breaking the bank. A batch of bakers compete to win Kirsties cake decorating trophy, theres advice on using pinecones to make cute Christmas characters and a look back at a favourite jewellery make from the archive

programme.title: The Great BandB Challenge
programme.desc: Paul and Justins garden party falls flat, while Jo and Guy are forced to improvise when there are issues in the market. Nicole and Brett try to cook an Indian feast using an international mix of ingredients

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Retired couple Debra and Gordon are looking for the perfect holiday home in the southern Spanish city of Torrevieja. This former fishing village has grown to become one of Spains most popular resorts, with acres of beautiful countryside and miles of spectacular coastlines hugging popular towns, villages and resorts. While Debra is keen on apartments, Gordon would love a townhouse for their budget of £120,000. Laura Hamilton shows them a selection of places that satisfy both of their desires, from a sea-view apartment and a property with a gym and a sauna to a tantalising townhouse

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: Stand Up to Cancer
programme.desc: People affected by cancer share their personal and moving stories, in a series of short films in aid of Stand Up To Cancer

programme.title: Grand Designs: House of the Year
programme.desc: The search for the House of the Year 2025 continues with a home in Bannau Brycheiniog, the Brecon Beacons, built from sandstone quarried in the mountains it overlooks. Also, a project that used modern methods to reinvent Norwichs medieval brick tradition and a Suffolk property where handmade brick and Douglas fir beams combine in a striking cruciform design. Finally, an 18th-century Essex barn brought back to life beam-by-beam, its historic frame repaired with seasoned oak using centuries-old techniques

programme.title: The Sycamore Gap Mystery
programme.desc: In September 2023, Northumberlands Sycamore Gap tree was cut down by vandals in the dead of night. The felling of this celebrated landmark, which had famously stood in a remote nook of Hadrians Wall for more than a century, provoked outrage, disbelief and grief among the public. This two-part documentary tells the story of the police investigation that followed, from the first 999 calls to the breakthroughs that led to the arrests of friends Adam Carruthers and Daniel Graham, and reveals the twists and turns of one of the most shocking acts of vandalism in recent British history

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics cast their eyes over 2021s biggest Christmas TV shows. Theyll be passing comment on the most talked about hits from the festive season, including Michael McIntyres Christmas Wheel, First Dates at Christmas, Strictly the Real Full Monty, Jamie: Together at Christmas, Love Actually, Worlds Strongest Man, I Can See Your Voice Christmas Special, The Repair Shop at Christmas, Elves, Nigellas Cook, Eat, Repeat, and No Time to Die

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts a hybrid of the comedy panel show and words-and-numbers quiz, as on Jon Richardson and Guz Khan take on guest captain Katherine Ryan and Joe Wilkinson. Mathematician Rachel Riley looks after the letters and numbers, while Alasdair Beckett-King joins lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef tries to help the owners of Iberville Cuisine and Oyster Bar, in the heart of the French Quarter in New Orleans. They want to be reinvigorated before Super Bowl LIX kicks off in the citys Caesars Superdome - and the tourist trade that comes with hosting the biggest sporting event in America

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Toby Bost, the CEO of ONeill Clothing, poses as a contestant on a reality TV show who is trying to win money to open his own surf shop. His aim is to ensure his upcoming US outlets are successful and will beat any similar competition to the number-one spot

programme.title: Double the Money
programme.desc: In the grand final, the contestants have four weeks to turn £10,000 into £20,000 and whoever makes the most money will also win an extra £20,000. As the clock starts ticking, the teams reveal their final ideas and theyre more ambitious than ever. Despite knowing absolutely nothing about cars, one team decided to launch a used car business but after exhausting all their opportunities and with very few sales in sight, they switch course in a desperate attempt to stay in the running. Another team aim to clinch the title using pure hard graft, as they launch a pizza van business and hope to bring home the dough slice by slice. Other teams opt for selling nutritious lunchtime bowls and launching an entire coffee brand. Will the grind pay off? When the time runs out and the clock stops for the final time, the teams return to The Vault, where one pair are crowned the series winners

programme.title: Stand Up to Cancer
programme.desc: People affected by cancer share their personal and moving stories, in a series of short films in aid of Stand Up To Cancer

programme.title: Cancer Detectives: Finding the Cures
programme.desc: Neurosurgeon and scientist Richard Mair races to treat patients with deadly brain cancers as part of a world-first clinical trial intended to give patients more time. He analyses patients tumour DNA and rapidly matches them with targeted drugs. It could be the biggest leap forward in brain cancer for 30 years. Taking part in the trial is family man David, whos having brain surgery and tests to discover if he has an aggressive cancer. Amanda was one of the first people to join Richards trial, after discovering that her brain tumour had returned. She prepares to hear the results of some vital tests

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Cumbria is the location for three more couples to demonstrate their cooking and hosting skills, kicking off with teachers Rory and Sam, who serve up dishes inspired by Europe. Day two sees Sarka and Paul lay on a Czech menu, but the massive portions defeat everyone - except the ever-hungry Rory. Finally, its the turn of John and Sally with their retro 1980s evening. Which couple will win the cash prize of £1,000?

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Georges favourite toy Mr Dinosaur breaks, so he goes to Mr Foxs shop to get a replacement and spots Dino Roar - which has a host of new features

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.sub-title: Grandpa Pigs Train to the Rescue

programme.desc: For more than half a century the Oxford Street Christmas lights have been a feature of one of Britains most famous streets, with celebrities from Madonna to Terry Wogan and Kylie to Robbie Williams switching them on. This documentary charts all the highs and lows of the London thoroughfares festive lights, from their first incarnation in 1959 to cheer the national mood to the very latest LED show-topping glory in 2024. When Oxford Street lights up, rivalry, famous stars and mountains of baubles are all part of the amazing experience that keeps shoppers and tourists coming back for more

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: A round-up of memorable moments featured on the show over the course of 2022. The armchair critics, including the Siddiquis, Giles and Mary, Jenny and Lee, Ellie and Izzi, Marcus and Mica, Amira and Iqra and Roisin and Joe, share their opinions on Strictly Come Dancing, Im a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here!, Ninja Warrior: Race for Glory, Coronation Street, Secret Crush, Frozen Planet II, BBC News coverage of the Queen lying in state, Heartstopper, This Morning, Britains Got Talent, Gordon Ramsays Future Food Stars, Sue Perkins: Perfectly Legal, Bad Sisters and Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Dina, 39, is keen to settle down and start a family, but her date, 41-year-old Stephen, is a born adventurer who has climbed the Matterhorn and swum oceans. Will he run a mile when she shares her intentions with him? Margaret, 73, hasnt been on a date for 44 years and is looking for a family man who shares her love of music and life, while art student Rachel, meets vegan singer-songwriter and self-confessed hippie Hari

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The guys invite the girls to a Dungeons and Dragons night when their trip to Vegas falls through after an incident with airport security. However, following a few drinks, Sheldon and Amys relationship takes an unexpected turn. Meanwhile, Raj goes on a date with Lucy, who tries to sneak out of the restaurants bathroom window - but ends up getting stuck and calling for his help

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard is offered an exciting job opportunity, but it will mean he has to leave the country for several months. Penny tries to support his ambitions, while Sheldon is jealous and attempts to discourage him from accepting the post. Meanwhile, Raja pushes the boundaries with Lucy, but puts their relationship in jeopardy

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose their favourite from a line-up of potential dates who reveal themselves one body part at a time - in all their naked glory. First up is 22-year-old gym addict Sophie from Surrey, who is desperate to find a man who boasts a little banter. Next up is Dom, a 25-year-old wedding model from Bournemouth. He wants to find the perfect man to waltz him down the aisle and thinks people that can guarantee to do this are confident, daring and adventurous in their outlook

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil thinks hes found the perfect present for Jays birthday. Meanwhile, a difficult encounter is on the cards for Andy and Haley. Starring Ed ONeill and Julie Bowen

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.sub-title: A High-Pitched Buzz and Training Wheels
programme.desc: The prodigy dismantles the refrigerator to stop it making an annoying humming noise and is then forced to get a paper round to pay for the repairs to the damaged appliance. Comedy spin-off prequel to The Big Bang Theory, starring Iain Armitage

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.sub-title: A Rival Prodigy and Sir Isaac Neutron
programme.desc: Meemaw intervenes when Sheldon gets jealous of Dr Sturgis bonding with Paige, a rival 10-year-old genius. In the meantime, Mary invites Paiges family over for a play date

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: There is impending chaos in the air when Jay holds a Super Bowl party at the same time as Claire is hosting Haleys baby shower - both events being in Jays house

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Beverly is pitted against a rival mother when she tries to micro-manage Barry and Ericas search for college places, while Erica tells Pops that she has tried to enhance her prospects by lying about her extracurricular activities. Comedy, starring Wendi McLendon-Covey and Jeff Garlin

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Adam plans to attend the school dance with Dana, and reluctantly agrees to take dancing lessons with Beverly. Meanwhile, Murray is forced to have the talk with Adam, but he admits that he hasnt spoken to Barry about sex yet. Comedy, starring Wendi McLendon-Covey and Jeff Garlin

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: When Calvin is overwhelmed by work, Dave volunteers to counsel his friend - while also logging the hours that he needs for his therapist certification

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.sub-title: Welcome to the Art of Negotiation
programme.desc: When Dave is up for a promotion, Calvin tries to help him negotiate a raise from his penny-pinching new boss. Tina cant decide whether she should share sensitive information

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: When Calvin stumbles upon a big business opportunity, he must convince Malcolm to help him to seal the deal. Gemma has to confront a secret from her beauty pageant past

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Mercedes and Ste spiral as loved ones step in to help. Donnys concerns over Dodger continue to grow. And there is turmoil for one family

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Ste tries to do the right thing, but a text leads Lucas to jump to conclusions, a resident fights to keep the past hidden and Liberty tries to pull her family back together

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube
programme.desc: Comedy clips showcasing amusing internet videos featuring sheep

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef tries to change the fortunes of Finn McCools, a traditional Irish pub in the Hamptons, New York. The chances of the establishment becoming a success are being ruined by the owner Buddy Mazzios two sons, bartender Jason and chef Brian, who are constantly fighting with each other, prompting Gordon to have a heart-to-heart with the family

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Beverly confronts her husband after discovering her engagement ring is the same one Murray gave to his former fiancee. Assisted by Pops, Adam looks to a romantic comedy film for inspiration when trying to capture the attention of his attractive neighbour. Comedy, starring Wendi McLendon-Covey and Jeff Garlin

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.sub-title: Who Are You Going to Telephone?
programme.desc: Adam abandons Pops to go trick-or-treating with some new friends, but he gets a shock when he discovers what they are really planning. Meanwhile, Beverly dons a costume so she can attend a teenagers Halloween party in secret and protect Barry from social humiliation. Comedy, starring Wendi McLendon-Covey and Jeff Garlin

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa tries to live a double life when she makes a new friend and gets a taste of what it would be like to live with a more family more cultured than her own

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: Im Dancing as Fat as I Can
programme.desc: Homer angers Marge by binge-watching their favourite show on his own and has to pick up a new skill to make amends. Meanwhile, Bart prepares to compete in Krustys Holiday Trample

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon cannot contain his jealousy when he hears that his university colleague Bert has won a prestigious fellowship with an impressive grant. Elsewhere, Howard finds an old remote-controlled toy he made in the past, but the rest of the group do not seemed to be too impressed by it. Stephen Hawking guest stars

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon, Amy, Leonard and Penny do their best to divide up all their possessions into two separate households, but tension ensues. Raj and Stuart compete to become indispensable to Howard and Bernadette as the babys arrival looms. Christopher Lloyd guest stars

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Dunphys and Manny are on their way back from breakfast at the pancake house when Phil is forced to swerve out of the way of an oncoming truck, a brush with death that prompts them all to re-evaulate their lives. Comedy, starring Ty Burrell

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire confronts neighbours from hell Ronnie and Amber about the eyesore of a boat on their front lawn - and when they refuse to move it, Phil has no alternative but to call in the big guns - dad Frank and a few of his retired pals. Meanwhile, Cam takes Lily to clown school

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon invites a famous physicist to the flat after befriending her online, but is put out to find Leonard showing an interest in her. Meanwhile, Penny has to confront her ex-boyfriend when the visitor turns up in his bedroom. Guest starring Judy Greer (Glenn Martin, DDS)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The comedy flashes back to reveal how Sheldon saved the lives of his pals, and looks at the origins of his friendship with Leonard seven years previously, as well as explaining the housemates agreement. Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons star

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Raj and Howard register Sheldon with an online dating site hoping to find his perfect female equivalent. Meanwhile, a drunk Penny seduces Leonard, but regrets it the next day. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco. Mayim Bialik makes her first appearance on the show

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny is stunned when Sheldon announces he is about to go on his first-ever date, and is even more surprised to find herself tagging along. Meanwhile, Leonard and Raj take a trip to the hospital after Howards new robotic arm creates problems

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.sub-title: A Crisis of Faith and Octopus Aliens
programme.desc: Following a tragic accident in the local community, Marys faith is shaken. Seeing his mother doubt everything she believes, Sheldon becomes an unlikely ally. Comedy, starring Iain Armitage and Zoe Perry

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.sub-title: A Financial Secret and Fish Sauce
programme.desc: When Sheldons father asks him to keep a secret from Mary, the stress of not being honest drives him to Tams for his first sleepover. Comedy, starring Iain Armitage

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer gets a new assistant, but when she steals his job, he teams up with Ned Flanders to reveal her dark past. Meanwhile, Barts mechanical seal outshines Lisas model asteroid in a science fair project. With the voice of Jane Lynch

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Things look bleak for Krusty the Clown when his TV show is binned and he is dropped by his talent agency. But then he is reunited with the veteran agent (Joan Rivers) who got him started in showbusiness all those years ago, and together they plan his big comeback

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard faces the difficult decision of choosing between his relationship with Priya and his friendship with Penny, while Sheldon is irritated by one of Howards magic tricks. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is distraught when his online gaming account is hacked, so his friends decide to find out who is responsible. However, they make the disastrous mistake of confronting the culprit in person. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Amy and Sheldon start a gossip experiment to see how quickly rumours spread among the gang, while Howard tells his friends he is planning to propose to Bernadette - not realising Raj is wrestling with his own feelings for her. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons, Mayim Bialik and Johnny Galecki

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is infuriated when Priya uses her legal knowledge to find a loophole in the room-mate agreement - but his spirits are lifted by a night on the town with Amy, Penny and Bernadette. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons, Johnny Galecki and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Mr Burns realises he has no heir and decides to hold auditions, intending to choose one from the children of Springfield. Unfortunately, only Bart comes close to fitting the bill

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Barts antics with family dog Santas Little Helper cause mayhem, and ultimately result in Principal Skinner getting the sack and eternal do-gooder Ned Flanders being appointed in his place

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Theresa returns to the village with her eyes set on Dodger, while Donny faces some hard home truths. And Lucass bid for Dillons attention reaches a concerning new height

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The family constructs a tennis court in the back garden and Bart becomes an expert player, much to the annoyance of a jealous Homer. Featuring the guest voices of Venus and Serena Williams, Andre Agassi and Pete Sampras

programme.title: Americas Next Top Model
programme.desc: The final three each shoot video reports on fashion and beauty practices in Morocco. And allegations at a Moroccan wedding-themed photo shoot

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their thoughts on shows including Starstruck, The Piano, You, Rick Steins Cornwall, Stacey Dooley Sleeps Over USA, 24 Hours in AandE, a This Morning feature about the worlds longest tongue and ITV News reporting on cheese. From February 2023

programme.title: First Dates Specials
programme.desc: The restaurant hosts the festive party to end all parties with a programme full of amazing surprises as maitre d Fred and his Christmas Cupids celebrate a year that has seen love blossom into wedding proposals, engagement rings and the very first First Dates baby. Couples Aarron and Ibiba, Doreen and James, Will and Fran and Ajai and Hema all make a welcome return to the place where it all began, while previous participants get another chance to find love

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose their favourite from a line-up of potential dates who reveal themselves one body part at a time - in all their naked glory. First up is 19-year-old student Marlie from Yorkshire, who keeps choosing the bad boys - which is driving her mum mad. Theres also 30-year-old Adam, from Bradford. Having previously had his heart broken, he is now looking for a woman with no secrets, and believes that if the contestants are willing to bare all on TV, they probably have nothing to hide

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Penny bond as they miss Leonard, and Howard tries to help Raj get over his break-up with Lucy. Meanwhile, Bernadette and Amy visit an out-of-town biology convention. Comedy about four high-achieving scientists, starring Jim Parsons, Kaley Cuoco and Johnny Galecki

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard returns from his research expedition in the North Sea and undergoes an adjustment period with Sheldon. Howard experiences an unusual emotional reaction as a result of his relationship with his mother. Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Simon Helberg star

programme.title: Arizona Raiders
programme.desc: In the aftermath of the American Civil War, two Confederate soldiers are offered a way out of jail. Their former comrades-in-arms are now a gang of bandits terrorising Arizona, and the two prisoners are sent to infiltrate the group and bring them to justice. Western, starring Audie Murphy, Buster Crabbe, Ben Cooper and Gloria Talbott

programme.title: Cover Girl
programme.desc: Dancer Rusty Parker works in a small New York club with her choreographer boyfriend Danny McGuire, but gets a taste of fame when she wins a competition to appear on the cover of a prestigious magazine. This in turn leads to her starring in hit musical, though her success has a dramatic effect on her relationship with Danny. Musical comedy, starring Rita Hayworth and Gene Kelly

programme.title: Gift Horse
programme.desc: A Navy captain reluctantly takes command of an old US destroyer during the Second World War and struggles with a crew who do not respect his authority. However, the prospect of facing the mighty German force brings much-needed unity. Adventure, starring Trevor Howard, Richard Attenborough, Bernard Lee, Sonny Tufts and James Donald

programme.title: The Moonraker
programme.desc: A foppish royalist nobleman leads a double life as a Roundhead-baiting highwayman. However, after Cromwells final victory at the battle of Worcester, the dashing hero has to smuggle the son of Charles I to safety in France. Swashbuckling adventure, starring George Baker, Sylvia Syms, Marius Goring, John Le Mesurier and Patrick Troughton

programme.title: Instant Family
programme.desc: After being taunted by relatives who think they will never have kids, married couple Pete and Ellie Wagner consider the option of adopting a child. However, they get more than they bargained for when they take in a rebellious teen and her two siblings. Director Sean Anders comedy, starring Mark Wahlberg, Rose Byrne and Isabela Merced

programme.title: Transporter 2
programme.desc: A retired former special forces agent has the job of chauffeuring the son of a controversial Miami politician. When Russian criminals kidnap the youngster and inject him with a virus in the hope of infecting his father, the driver sets out to find the boy and his abductors. Action thriller sequel, starring Jason Statham, Alessandro Gassman and Amber Valletta

programme.title: Inglourious Basterds
programme.desc: American officer Aldo Raine leads a squad of soldiers into occupied France on a mission to kill as many Nazis as possible and spread fear through the Third Reich. They become involved in a Jewish resistance fighters plan to blow up the premiere of a propaganda movie - due to be attended by Hitler himself. Quentin Tarantinos wartime adventure, with Brad Pitt, Melanie Laurent, Diane Kruger, Michael Fassbender and an Oscar-winning Christoph Waltz

programme.title: A Private Function
programme.desc: In post-war Yorkshire, with rationing still very much in force, a mild-mannered chiropodist tries to prove his worth to the snobbish locals by kidnapping a pig which is being fattened up for a local banquet. Alan Bennetts comedy, starring Michael Palin, Maggie Smith, Denholm Elliott, Alison Steadman and Liz Smith

programme.title: Hangmans Knot
programme.desc: Confederate soldiers wipe out a group of Union troops carrying a shipment of gold, but later learn the Civil War ended the month before, rendering their attack a criminal act. The soldiers go on the run with the loot, but their worries deepen when they are besieged by bandits. Western, starring Randolph Scott, Donna Reed, Lee Marvin and Richard Denning.

programme.title: The Winslow Boy
programme.desc: The father of a Navy cadet accused of theft goes to great lengths to restore his sons tarnished reputation. Historical courtroom drama based on a play by Terence Rattigan, starring Robert Donat, Margaret Leighton, Cedric Hardwicke and Basil Radford.

programme.title: Hell Is a City
programme.desc: A tough criminal escapes from jail and hatches a scheme to rob a wealthy bookie, little realising a hardened copper is hot on his trail. Thriller, starring Stanley Baker, John Crawford, Donald Pleasence and Billie Whitelaw

programme.title: The Swimmer
programme.desc: A world-weary man embarks on a unique odyssey of self-discovery, attempting to reach home by diving into and swimming in the neighbourhood pools along his route. Director Frank Perrys cult drama, starring Burt Lancaster, Kim Hunter and Janice Rule

programme.title: A Room with a View
programme.desc: A naive woman accompanies an older cousin on a trip to Florence, where she falls in love with a forward-thinking man. She is forced to cut short the romance and return to a loveless engagement in England, where the object of her affection makes an unexpected appearance. Period drama from James Ivory, based on EM Forsters novel and starring Helena Bonham Carter, Maggie Smith, Denholm Elliott, Daniel Day-Lewis, Julian Sands and Judi Dench

programme.title: Transporter 3
programme.desc: Underworld courier Frank Martins latest assignment involves transporting the kidnapped daughter of a crooked government minister across Europe on behalf of an eco-terrorist faction. However, a device will kill him if he leaves his car, thugs employed by the politician are out to murder him, and his passenger has a bad case of Stockholm syndrome. Action thriller sequel, with Jason Statham and Natalya Rudakova

programme.title: Fury
programme.desc: A veteran American sergeant leads a tank crew on one final dangerous mission in the last months of the Second World War. The assignment takes the soldiers behind enemy lines and into battle with overwhelming enemy forces, while the presence of an inexperienced new recruit in the team raises tension. Drama, starring Brad Pitt and Shia LaBeouf

programme.title: Monos
programme.desc: A group of feral teenage guerrilla soldiers, named Monos, live on a mountain top above the clouds of Latin America. They are charged with guarding an American prisoner and a cow, neither of which can be harmed. Writer/director Alejandro Landess adventure thriller, starring Sofia Buenaventura, Julián Giraldo and Karen Quintero. In English and Spanish, with English subtitles

Martial arts adventure, starring Jean-Claude Van Damme and Sho Kosugi
